entries.text: Come join an innovative talented engineering department where you can do some serious Perl programming in a great development environment with clean codebase that is not slapped together. If interested in learning more please contact Marc Spinowitz, Recruiter at MediaMath at mspinowitz@mediamath.com or 646-532-5914
entries.title: MediaMath is hiring Perl Developers: Are you tired of Perl 'scripting'?

entries.text: Come and work for our small development team based in Oxford, UK where you can make a real impact, and have an opportunity to work on every aspect of our infrastructure from UI design to scaling. Get in touch at jobs@adestra.com.
entries.title: Adestra are hiring Perl developers to work on our Modern Perl/Catalyst/Moose/DBIC codebase.

chapters.footer: If you are interested posting your job add in the Perl Weekly or on the Perl 5 Maven site, please get in touch with me. ~ Gabor
chapters.title: Sponsors

entries.text: How better to celebrate Easters than with a little Exodus? The centralized Perl svn repository site served us well for many years, but now it is time for it to bow down and vanishes into a well-deserved retirement. CPAN authors, take heed: April 27th is when the lights will go out.
entries.title: svn.perl.org shutdown in one month

entries.text: Giel Goudsmit reminisces about the last 10 years of Bookings.com, and how he saw it grow from its modest origins to the behemoth it is today.
entries.title: The Little Script That Could

entries.author: sinan_unur
entries.text: Sinan Unur amuses himself and comes up with an elegant way of solving that problem.
entries.title: Creating a matrix of random entries where lengths of the columns are also random

entries.text: miyagawa gleefully announces a toolchain milestone: the segregation of build and test dependencies is now truly grokked by all major players.
entries.title: test_requires all the way

entries.author: joel_berger
entries.text: Sometimes, your proudest achievement is the module that oozes out pizzazz like red dwarves pour out radiation. Sometimes, it's the little humble module that is just does the job with no fuss. Joel Berger professes his love for  Tie::Array::CSV, which definitively belongs to the second category.
entries.title: A Case for Tie::Array::CSV

entries.text: I once compared Dist::Zilla to the bat-mobile: very powerful, but a little daunting for the casual driver. miyagawa tries to address that with 'Milla',  which tries to take care of most of the dzillish complexity for you.
entries.title: Milla, a Dist::Zilla profile that doesn't suck

entries.author: david_golden
entries.text: David Golden shares with us some of the scripts and tricks he uses to facilitate the ebbs of pull requests.
entries.title: How I've started managing GitHub pulls

entries.text: Dominic Humphries narrates the birth of his first module, and shows us all how easily one can slip into CPAN authorhood (getting out, now, that's a totally different kettle of fish).
entries.title: I made a module!

entries.author: brian_d_foy
entries.text: Don't know? Dont' worry: brian d foy explains.
entries.title: Why Perl's conditional operator is right associative

entries.author: thomas_klausner
entries.text: Gabor walks us through how one can set up a nice static blog using domm's Blio blogging engine.
entries.title: Building a static blog using Blio and Github

entries.text: SSL tends to make things... a trifle more complicated. David Precious explains how to make LWP::UserAgent play well with secure urls.
entries.title: Using SSL client certs with Perl's LWP::UserAgent

entries.text: Ever got a mysterious error when calling Mojolicious's 'render_later' method? Max explains what it means.
entries.title: Mojolicous, render_later and weaken transactions

entries.text: HabitRPG is a todo / habit tracker application with a twist: it turns mundane activities into a fantasy RPG. Paul Fenwick, with his usual flare for the ubernifty, wrote  a Perl module -- and a command-line interface -- to interact with the system. Killing orcs, merging pull requests, it can all be part of your typical working days, now.
entries.title: Gamifiy your command line with HabitRPG

entries.author: thomas_klausner
entries.text: Perl packages have to end with a true value. Typically, that's '1'. But some authors get more... creative. domm sends his module hunting for those peculiar  true values, and aggregates them for our viewing pleasure.
entries.title: Acme::ReturnValue 1.001

entries.author: alberto_simoes
entries.text: Alberto Simoes called for a the new round of grant proposals. In case you have ideas for projects, but don't have time to do them, you can add them in the comment section allowing people with time, but without projects to submit grant proposals.
entries.title: 2013Q2 Call for Grant Proposals

entries.author: karen_pauley
entries.text: Karen Pauley announced the cooperation with the GNOME Foundation. There is money for one intern to participate.
entries.title: Outreach Program for Women

entries.text: In this first broadcast of GitMinutes, Randal L. Schwartz talks about Git, Perl and, oh..., his favorite editor.
entries.title: GitMinutes #01: Randal L. Schwartz on the Development of Git

entries.text: Jeff Thalhammer talks about Pinto on FLOSS Weekly. 'nuff said.
entries.title: Jeff Thalhammer interview on FLOSS Weekly

entries.title: Chicago.PM - Dependency Injection (also: Beam::Wire)

entries.title: Rakudo's Abstract Syntax Tree

You can find details about them in the 'Events' section at the end of the newsletter.
